name: keyWentDown()
content:
Checks if the key specified was pressed.

Some interactive games use the keyboard for the user input to control the game. keyWentDown() generates a single true value when the key is pressed down, no matter how long a key is pressed. Use `keyDown()` to continually check if the key is pressed.

examples.name: Click Counter

palette_params.name: code
palette_params.description: The name of key you want to check. Keys without a letter or number have names like "up", "left", "shift", "tab", "space", etc.

short_description: Checks if the key specified was pressed.
tips: - When testing your games that use keyboard or mouse input make sure you click in the display area before you run, otherwise the Workspace will record your keyboard and mouse actions.
